Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2007 03:41PM dlrcpa wrote: mmp, I think that the reason to send you to a surgeon is that a breast surgeon will have seen various types of problems before and may be able to identify it since the original doctor is not sure. In November I managed to bruise the breast that I had treated for invasive ductal cancer 2 years ago. It was all red and purple, did not look like a "normal bruise" to me. I was scared witless and got in to see my radiology doctor as fast as I could. (She was the first doctor able to see me, I also called the oncologist.) She took a careful look at me and said I had bruised myself, it was not IBC. She knew because she'd seen both situations before. She said come back in a week and if it's not better, we will order more tests. In my case a week later, it was clearly a bruise that was healing. So an experienced doctor who's seen it all will be the best one to judge. Good luck, I hope it turns out to be something minor. -- Donna in VA
Posts.Title: Any info would be helpful mmp2974 debxman
